name: Polish Sloppy Joes
author: Laurie Musial
summary: This is a recipe from my Husband's grandmother. Even people that aren't crazy about sauerkraut have raved about them. For a Rueben twist, serve on a good rye roll with a slice of Swiss.
ingredients: 1 (32 ounce) jar sauerkraut with caraway seed
1  green bell pepper, seeded and diced
1 pinch salt and pepper to taste
directions: Crumble the ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook and stir until no longer pink
Pour in the sauerkraut and chicken broth and add the green pepper, celery and onion
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve on a good hard roll or a semmel (Kaiser) roll
